weapons.name: Master Sword
weapons.description: La espada legendaria que sella la oscuridad. Su hoja brilla con un brillo sagrado que puede oponerse a la calamidad. Sólo un héroe elegido por la espada misma puede empuñarla

weapons.name: Tree Branch
weapons.description: Wooden branches such as this are pretty common, but it's surprisingly well-balanced. It doesn't do much damage but can serve as a weapon in a pinch.

weapons.name: Torch
weapons.description: This torch will stay lit once ignited. If you put it away, the flame will be extinguished until you light it again.

weapons.name: Soup Ladle
weapons.description: A kitchen implement often used for serving delicious soups. It was carved from the wood of a sturdy tree, so it actually packs quite the wallop.

weapons.name: Boomerang
weapons.description: This throwing weapon was originally used by the forest-dwelling Koroks. Its unique shape allows it to return after being thrown.

weapons.name: Spring-Loaded Hammer
weapons.description: This strange hammer is one of Kilton's specialties. Being struck by it doesn't hurt much, but the fourth swing in a string of attacks will send the victim flying.

weapons.name: Traveler's Sword
weapons.description: A very common sword often kept by travelers to fend off small beasts. It's fairly durable, but a bit unreliable against monsters.

weapons.name: Soldier's Broadsword
weapons.description: A sword brandished by the soldiers who once protected Hyrule Castle. Its durable blade is well tuned for slaying monsters.

weapons.name: Knight's Broadsword
weapons.description: Knights of Hyrule once carried this sword. These days it's the weapon of choice for seasoned adventurers thanks to its ease of use and high attack power.

weapons.name: Royal Broadsword
weapons.description: The Hyrulean royal family would award this sword to knights who achieved remarkable feats. A sword that balances strength and beauty as elegantly as this one is a rare find.

weapons.name: Forest Dweller's Sword
weapons.description: Koroks made this sword for Hylians. It's made of wood, so it isn't the best choice for head-on attacks. Its original intent was likely clearing vines to forge paths through forests.

weapons.name: Zora Sword
weapons.description: The ornamentation that adorns this blade is a traditional Zora design. It's forged from a very durable and rust-proof metal.

weapons.name: Feathered Edge
weapons.description: Rito craftsmen forged this lightweight, double-edge sword so Rito warriors could soar into battle unhindered by its weight.

weapons.name: Gerudo Scimitar
weapons.description: This common sword is often carried by Gerudo women for self-defense. Its short, curved blade is easily recognized.

weapons.name: Moonlight Scimitar
weapons.description: Delicate Gerudo carvings decorate this curved sword. The engraved blade is extremely sharp. Apparently it once served ceremonial purposes in festivals.

weapons.name: Scimitar of the Seven
weapons.description: A famous sword once beloved by the Gerudo Champion Urbosa. It is said that when Urbosa swung this sword in battle, her movements resembled a beautiful dance.

weapons.name: Eightfold Blade
weapons.description: A single-edged sword traditional to the Sheikah tribe. Forged using ancient technology it just may be among the sharpest conventional weapons ever made.

weapons.name: Ancient Short Sword
weapons.description: The blade of this sword was made using an ancient power lost to this modern age. Its blade appears only when drawn, and its cutting power surpasses metal swords.

weapons.name: Rusty Broadsword
weapons.description: A rusty sword used ages ago by a skilled swordsman. It can do some damage in the right hands but also breaks quickly.

weapons.name: Royal Guard's Sword
weapons.description: A Sheikah-made replica of the sword that seals the darkness. It was made with ancient technology to oppose the Great Calamity, but its low durability made it inefficient.

weapons.name: Flameblade
weapons.description: This magical sword was forged in the lava of Death Mountain. It leaves white-hot flames in its wake when the blade glows red.

weapons.name: Frostblade
weapons.description: A magical sword forged in the frigid mountains of the Hebra region. When the blade glows blue, enemies struck by it will become frozen.

weapons.name: Thunderblade
weapons.description: A magical sword forged and refined by lightning from the Hyrule Hills. When the blade shines with a golden light, it will electrocute enemies struck by it.

weapons.name: Goddess Sword
weapons.description: A sword said to have once belonged to a hero from the sky. Its blade houses the fire of the Goddess. When wielded, a strange yet heavenly breeze kicks up around you.

weapons.name: Sword
weapons.description: A sword once wielded by a hero in an ancient age. When grasped, a strange sense of nostalgia washes over you. Take it when going alone would otherwise be dangerous.

weapons.name: Sea-Breeze Boomerang
weapons.description: A boomerang said to have been used by a hero who traveled the Great Sea. It smells faintly of salt water.

weapons.name: Boko Club
weapons.description: A crude Bokoblin club made to clobber small prey. It's essentially a stick, so its durability is low.

weapons.name: Spiked Boko Club
weapons.description: A reinforced Bokoblin club made to maximize damage. The sharpened bones jabbed into it make it a brutal weapon.

weapons.name: Dragonbone Boko Club
weapons.description: This Bokoblin club has been reinforced with fossilized bones to maximize clobbering potential. Only the brawniest of Bokoblins can manage its immense weight.

weapons.name: Lizal Boomerang
weapons.description: A curved sword favored by the Lizalfos. It can be used to attack directly or can be thrown like a boomerang.

weapons.name: Lizal Forked Boomerang
weapons.description: Blue Lizalfos in particular like this weapon. It has one more blade than the Lizal boomerang to give it additional cutting power, and it still returns when thrown.

weapons.name: Lizal Tri-Boomerang
weapons.description: More blades means more attack power! It can be used as a boomerang, but all those blades makes that a bit more dangerous. Carried by Black Lizalfos seasoned in battle.

weapons.name: Guardian Sword
weapons.description: A sword often wielded by Guardian Scouts. Its blue energy blade is a product of ancient technology. It's not very durable.

weapons.name: Guardian Sword+
weapons.description: This Guardian sword has enhanced power over the standard model. Its cutting capabilities are improved, and its durability has seen a slight uptick.

weapons.name: Guardian Sword++
weapons.description: The abilities of this Guardian sword have been boosted to the maximum, as evidenced by its increase in size. It slices through armor like a hot knife through butter!

weapons.name: Lynel Sword
weapons.description: This Lynel-made sword was designed with smashing in mind rather than slicing. It's on the heavy side compared to what Hylians are used to, but it's very strong.

weapons.name: Mighty Lynel Sword
weapons.description: This Lynel-made sword boasts more blades and more attack power. A skilled Lynel can draw this sword simply in passing and still cut a foe in two.

weapons.name: Savage Lynel Sword
weapons.description: A brutal sword carried by white-haired Lynels. The savage blades are strong enough to cut down any foe, no matter how strong.

weapons.name: Meteor Rod
weapons.description: A magical rod that can cast three fireballs at once, crafted by an ancient magician. It will break upon running out of magical energy, so make it last!

weapons.name: Ice Rod
weapons.description: A magical rod crafted from refined ice found in the Hebra Mountains. This rod can cast waves of freezing air. Great for magic—not so great for melee.

weapons.name: Blizzard Rod
weapons.description: A magical rod that can cast extreme cold in a wide range. These are crafted from refined ice found at the summit of Hebra Peak. It will break when depleted.

weapons.name: Lightning Rod
weapons.description: A magical rod that can shoot balls of electricity. Its gem contains lightning from the Hyrule Hills. It's not recommended to use as a melee weapon.

weapons.name: Thunderstorm Rod
weapons.description: A magical rod that can hurl three balls of electricity at once. Its gem contains electricity from the Hyrule Hills, and the rod will break when that electricity runs out.

weapons.name: Vicious Sickle
weapons.description: A grim weapon favored by the Yiga. The half-moon shape of the blade allows for the rapid delivery of fatal wounds and serves as a symbol of their terror. Its durability is low.

weapons.name: Demon Carver
weapons.description: This lethal weapon is forged by the Yiga. Its unique shape facilitates the sound dispatching of any target and strikes fear into the hearts of all who see it.

weapons.name: Bokoblin Arm
weapons.description: A skeletal arm that keeps moving even after it's severed from its body. It's kind of gross to strap it to your back, but it'll do in a pinch. It's old and fragile, so it's quick to break.

weapons.name: Lizalfos Arm
weapons.description: The arm of a Stalizalfos that continues to struggle even in death. It can be used as a weapon, but it's very brittle. You can feel it wiggling when you strap it to your back...

weapons.name: Korok Leaf
weapons.description: A single swing of this giant, sturdy leaf can create a gust of wind strong enough to blow away light objects.

weapons.name: Farming Hoe
weapons.description: A farming tool primarily used for tilling fields. Its fine craftsmanship is sturdy enough to withstand backbreaking fieldwork, but its battle applications are untested.

weapons.name: Boat Oar
weapons.description: Made for paddling boats, but it was made sturdy enough to fight strong currents. Maybe it's useful for self-defense in a pinch.

weapons.name: Woodcutter's Axe
weapons.description: A woodcutter's tool of choice for felling trees. Its formidable weight and uneven balancing make it a slow, inefficient weapon.

weapons.name: Double Axe
weapons.description: This double-sided axe was designed with fighting in mind. It's a bit unwieldy, so it requires a well-practiced technique to use efficiently.

weapons.name: Iron Sledgehammer
weapons.description: This large iron sledgehammer was originally used for mining, but it works reasonably well as a weapon too.

weapons.name: Giant Boomerang
weapons.description: This massive boomerang requires two hands. Originally used for hunting, it was modified for use as a weapon. The blades on the inner curves make it a bit tricky to wield.

weapons.name: Traveler's Claymore
weapons.description: A basic two-handed sword often wielded by aspiring adventurers. Its immense weight can knock enemies' shields right out of their hands.

weapons.name: Soldier's Claymore
weapons.description: A two-handed sword designed for combat. It's heavy and hard to use but has decent build quality and durability.

weapons.name: Knight's Claymore
weapons.description: Only the most confident of Hyrule Castle's knights carried this two-handed sword. Its cutting edge is finely honed.

weapons.name: Royal Claymore
weapons.description: A two-handed sword issued to the Hyrulean royal family's immediate guard detail. Its powerful strikes are said to crush an opponent's body and resolve alike.

weapons.name: Silver Longsword
weapons.description: Although the Zora prefer spears to swords, they made this two-handed weapon using a special metal. It found popularity among Hylians for its unique design.

weapons.name: Cobble Crusher
weapons.description: A Goron-made two-handed weapon. It's made from thick, hard metal and has no cutting edge, so it relies on its sheer weight to crush all opponents.

weapons.name: Stone Smasher
weapons.description: A two-handed weapon forged from a rare metal mined in Goron City. Its center of gravity is at its tip, so it uses centrifugal force and its sheer weight to smash opponents flat.

weapons.name: Boulder Breaker
weapons.description: This two-handed weapon was once wielded by the Goron Champion Daruk. Daruk made swinging it around look easy, but a Hylian would need an immense amount of strength.

weapons.name: Golden Claymore
weapons.description: Only the most talented Gerudo sword fighters carry this two-handed sword. It's actually much lighter than it appears and is surprisingly easy to wield.

weapons.name: Eightfold Longblade
weapons.description: A single-edged sword seldom seen in Hyrule. This weapon is passed down through the Sheikah tribe and has an astonishingly sharp edge ideal for slicing.

weapons.name: Edge of Duality
weapons.description: A curious double-edged sword crafted using Sheikah technology. It was originally made for Hyrulean knights unfamiliar with single-edged blades.

weapons.name: Ancient Bladesaw
weapons.description: This two-handed sword was forged using ancient Sheikah technology. Its unique rotating blades give it impressive cutting power that will slice enemies to shreds.

weapons.name: Rusty Claymore
weapons.description: A two-handed sword not properly cared for. Although it can be used as a weapon, its durability is very low. Don't expect it to last for more than a few strikes.

weapons.name: Royal Guard's Claymore
weapons.description: The Sheikah used the very essence of ancient technology to forge this greatsword. It was designed to oppose the Calamity, but its low durability made it impractical in battle.

weapons.name: Great Flameblade
weapons.description: This magic-infused greatsword was forged in the fires of Death Mountain by Goron smiths in an ancient age. Attack when the blade glows red to expel flames.

weapons.name: Great Frostblade
weapons.description: This magic-infused greatsword was forged by smelting ore found in the Hebra Mountains' permafrost. Attack when the blade glows blue to expel freezing air.

weapons.name: Great Thunderblade
weapons.description: This magic-infused greatsword was forged by the Hyrulean royal family using lightning from the Hyrule Hills. Attack when the blade glows golden to expel lightning.

weapons.name: Sword of the Six Sages
weapons.description: The Six Sages are said to have forged this longsword to seal a demon king in the world where the hero fought against the beasts of twilight. The blade shines with a holy luster.

weapons.name: Biggoron's Sword
weapons.description: A legendary greatsword forged by a Goron craftsman for a hero who traveled through time. The exceptionally sharp cutting edge is a testament to the craftsman's mastery.

weapons.name: Fierce Deity Sword
weapons.description: A peculiar greatsword allegedly used by a hero from a world in which the moon threatened to fall. It slashes wildly in battle as if possessed by a fierce deity.

weapons.name: Boko Bat
weapons.description: A clunky club made by a Bokoblin. If you swing it at an enemy's shield, it may be able to knock the shield out of your foe's hand.

weapons.name: Spiked Boko Bat
weapons.description: After much consideration by Bokoblins on how to improve the Boko bat, they simply attached sharp spikes to it. A skilled fighter can cause immense damage with this.

weapons.name: Dragonbone Boko Bat
weapons.description: Used by only the toughest Bokoblin warriors, this Boko bat has been fortified by fossilized bone. It boasts a high durability and is strong enough to beat down powerful foes.

weapons.name: Moblin Club
weapons.description: A crudely fashioned club favored by Moblins. It's carved from a sturdy tree but is sloppily made, so it breaks easily.

weapons.name: Spiked Moblin Club
weapons.description: Animal bone has been affixed to this Moblin club to greatly improve its damage.

weapons.name: Dragonbone Moblin Club
weapons.description: The bone of an ancient beast has been affixed to this Moblin club, further increasing its damage. Moblins carrying these in battle are particularly dangerous.

weapons.name: Ancient Battle Axe
weapons.description: A weapon used by Guardian Scouts. Its unique blade was forged using ancient technology. Although powerful, its unusual shape causes it to break easily.

weapons.name: Ancient Battle Axe+
weapons.description: This ancient battle axe's damage output has been increased to maximum. It's sharp enough to cut through almost anything, so it may have been used to forge new routes.

weapons.name: Ancient Battle Axe++
weapons.description: This ancient battle axe's damage output is scaled up to peak performance. Ancient technology makes it possible to enhance cutting power beyond metal weapons' limits.

weapons.name: Lynel Crusher
weapons.description: This two-handed weapon is favored by the Lynels. It may be more accurate to call it a lump of metal than a weapon, but if wielded by a Lynel, it can pound you into a fine dust.

weapons.name: Mighty Lynel Crusher
weapons.description: This Lynel-made two-handed weapon has been reinforced to increase its durability and striking power. Its overwhelming heft will crush your foe, shield and all.

weapons.name: Savage Lynel Crusher
weapons.description: This Lynel-made two-handed weapon is immensely heavy thanks to a rare metal from Death Mountain's peak. The power of its downward swing is in a class all its own.

weapons.name: Windcleaver
weapons.description: This sword is favored by high-ranking members of the Yiga. When wielded by a proficient fighter, its unique shape cleaves the very wind and creates a vacuum.

weapons.name: Moblin Arm
weapons.description: A Moblin bone that continues to move even after being detached from its body. The bone is thick enough to be used as a weapon but is extremely brittle and easily broken.

weapons.name: Wooden Mop
weapons.description: Just a mop to the untrained eye, it excels at tidying up the place. But it owes its sturdy construction to a true craftsman, so it actually has some combat merit.

weapons.name: Farmer's Pitchfork
weapons.description: A farming tool used to collect hay efficiently. It's light enough to be used by anyone. The four prongs are very sharp.

weapons.name: Fishing Harpoon
weapons.description: A fisherman's tool that excels at catching large fish. Its particularly sharp spearhead makes it valuable as a weapon as well.

weapons.name: Throwing Spear
weapons.description: A specialized spear weighted to excel as a throwing weapon. It's perfectly balanced to be thrown farther than your average spear, able to pierce targets from a great distance.

weapons.name: Traveler's Spear
weapons.description: A spear used mainly by travelers to fend off wolves and other beasts. It's easy to hold and simple to use.

weapons.name: Soldier's Spear
weapons.description: A long spear once used by the guards of Hyrule Castle. Easy to use but difficult to master. The iron tip is very sturdy and the shaft will not burn when exposed to flame.

weapons.name: Knight's Halberd
weapons.description: A spear used by knights adept in mounted combat. The spearhead is modeled after an axe.

weapons.name: Royal Halberd
weapons.description: This spear was issued to the knights who guarded Hyrule Castle's throne room. Its ornate design was applied by a craftsman in service to the royal family.

weapons.name: Forest Dweller's Spear
weapons.description: The Koroks made this spear for Hylians. The shaft is made from a light, sturdy wood, offering ease of use. The spearhead is made from a much harder wood, offering strength.

weapons.name: Zora Spear
weapons.description: This spear is a Zora's weapon of choice. It's lighter than it looks due to being made from a special metal and is used by the Zora for both fishing and protecting their domain.

weapons.name: Silverscale Spear
weapons.description: The most skilled Zora fighters wield this spear. Its beautiful fish-tail design belies its impressive strength; the spearhead can pierce even the toughest scales.

weapons.name: Ceremonial Trident
weapons.description: A spear modeled after the Lightscale Trident wielded by the Zora Champion Mipha. They may be identical in appearance, but this spear's strength and durability are inferior.

weapons.name: Lightscale Trident
weapons.description: A spear of peerless grace cherished by the Zora Champion Mipha. Although Mipha specialized in healing abilities, her spearmanship was in a class all its own.

weapons.name: Drillshaft
weapons.description: Goron artisans used recycled metal to forge this weapon. The tip is made from an old excavation bore, which affords it unmatched piercing capabilities.

weapons.name: Feathered Spear
weapons.description: Its lightweight design is a hallmark of Rito craftsmanship. It's made from light and sturdy materials, which afford Rito warriors ease of use during aerial combat.

weapons.name: Gerudo Spear
weapons.description: This spear's center of gravity is in its tip, making it a bit unwieldy for the average fighter. But in the hands of a skilled Gerudo warrior, it's a weapon of reliable strength.

weapons.name: Serpentine Spear
weapons.description: The spearhead of this weapon is uniquely Sheikah in design. Spear masters of the Sheikah tribe can use the crescent shape to snag their opponents and deliver brutal cuts.

weapons.name: Ancient Spear
weapons.description: This spear is the result of countless hours of research into the ancient technology used by Guardians. The glowing spearhead has high piercing potential.

weapons.name: Rusty Halberd
weapons.description: A rusty polearm likely used by knights from an age past. The spearhead is in bad shape due to prolonged exposure to the elements, so its durability is low.

weapons.name: Royal Guard's Spear
weapons.description: This Sheikah-made spear was created using ancient technology to combat the Calamity. Its attack power is very high, but a critical design flaw left it with poor durability.

weapons.name: Flamespear
weapons.description: A magical spear forged in the magma of Death Mountain. Attack when the blade glows to expel powerful flames.

weapons.name: Frostspear
weapons.description: A magical spear forged from ancient ice taken from the Hebra Mountains. Attack when the blade glows blue to chill the air and freeze your foe.

weapons.name: Thunderspear
weapons.description: A magical spear that contains thunder from Thundra Plateau in its tip. Attack when the blade glows with a golden light to unleash an electrical attack.

weapons.name: Boko Spear
weapons.description: A spear recklessly carved from a tree branch. Useful for skewering fish and meat, which can then be cooked over a flame. If it's close to breaking, consider throwing it.

weapons.name: Spiked Boko Spear
weapons.description: A Boko spear enhanced with sharpened animal bones. It's light, easy to use, and deals a decent amount of damage.

weapons.name: Dragonbone Boko Spear
weapons.description: This Boko spear has been strengthened with fossilized bones. The bones are positioned outward so the fangs bite at the opponent. Beware Bokoblins carrying this weapon.

weapons.name: Moblin Spear
weapons.description: This wooden spear is most often used by Moblins. It's made from a hastily whittled tree, so its stabbing power and durability are both pretty low.

weapons.name: Spiked Moblin Spear
weapons.description: This Moblin-made spear uses a horned animal bone as the spearhead. Like many Moblin weapons it's sloppily made, but this one packs some respectable piercing power.

weapons.name: Dragonbone Moblin Spear
weapons.description: This spear is a fan favorite among Moblins. The spearhead is made from fossilized bones adorned with spikes, which greatly increases its stabbing power.

weapons.name: Lizal Spear
weapons.description: The brutal, ripping edge of this weapon’s spearhead is a distinctly Lizalfos design. Its low durability doesn’t lend itself to extended use.

weapons.name: Enhanced Lizal Spear
weapons.description: Judging by the harpoon-like spearhead of this Lizalfos-made spear, the Lizalfos use it for fishing as well as combat. Try not to get caught on the wrong end of its barbs.

weapons.name: Forked Lizal Spear
weapons.description: Skilled Lizalfos warriors tend to favor this spear. What it lacks in piercing power, it makes up for with the brutal wounds its dual ripping blades will inflict.

weapons.name: Guardian Spear
weapons.description: Wielded by Guardian Scouts, this spear has a high piercing power and is a testament to the Sheikah's high level of technology. the spearhead appears only when brandished.

weapons.name: Guardian Spear+
weapons.description: The tip of this Guardian spear has been enlarged and strengthened. It's a bit shorter than your average spear, perhaps to facilitate use in tight spaces.

weapons.name: Guardian Spear++
weapons.description: This Guardian spear's output has been boosted to the maximum. The spearhead is designed for optimal stabbing, capable of easily piercing most armor.

weapons.name: Lynel Spear
weapons.description: The crescent-shaped spearhead of this Lynel-made weapon gives it poor balance, making it difficult to wield. Lynels, however, can swing it effectively with a single hand.

weapons.name: Mighty Lynel Spear
weapons.description: The weight and cutting edge of this Lynel-made spear have both been enhanced. It's immensely heavy for a Hylian, but a Lynel can cleave through rock with a single swing.

weapons.name: Savage Lynel Spear
weapons.description: White-haired Lynels favor this brutal spear. Its axe-like spearhead and exceptional weight give it absolute destructive power.

bows.name: Bow of Light
bows.description: La princesa Zelda te dio este arco y flecha para la batalla con la bestia oscura Ganon. Cuando es manejado por el héroe, dispara flechas de luz pura lo suficientemente fuertes como para oponerse a la Calamidad.

bows.name: Traveler's Bow
bows.description: A small bow used by travelers for protection. It doesn't do a lot of damage, but it can be used to attack foes from a distance.

bows.name: Soldier's Bow
bows.description: A bow designed for armed conflict. Inflicts more damage than a civilian bow, but it will still burn if it touches fire.

bows.name: Knight's Bow
bows.description: The sturdy metal construction of this bow offers superior durability, while its lack of firing quirks makes it quite reliable. Once favored by the knights at Hyrule Castle.

bows.name: Royal Bow
bows.description: In the past, the king of Hyrule presented this bow to only the most talented archers in the land. Its combat capabilities are as impressive as its extravagant design.

bows.name: Forest Dweller's Bow
bows.description: The Koroks made this bow for Hylians. It's crafted from flexible wood and uses sturdy vines for the bowstring. Its construction may be simple, but it fires multiple arrows at once.

bows.name: Silver Bow
bows.description: A bow favored by the Zora for fishing. It doesn't boast the highest firepower, but the special metal it's crafted from prioritizes durability.

bows.name: Swallow Bow
bows.description: This bow is a favorite among Rito warriors. The bowstring has been specially engineered for aerial combat, which allows it to be drawn faster than a normal bow.

bows.name: Falcon Bow
bows.description: A highly refined Rito-made bow created by a master Rito craftsman. Rito warriors favor it for its superior rate of fire, which helps them excel even further at aerial combat.

bows.name: Great Eagle Bow
bows.description: A bow without equal wielded by the Rito Champion, Revali. It's said Revali could loose arrows with the speed of a gale, making him supreme in aerial combat.

bows.name: Golden Bow
bows.description: This Gerudo-made bow is popular for the fine ornamentations along its limbs. Designed for hunting and warfare alike, this bow was engineered to strike distant targets.

bows.name: Phrenic Bow
bows.description: A bow passed down through the Sheikah tribe. Concentrating before drawing the string will allow you to target distant enemies as easily as those nearby.

bows.name: Ancient Bow
bows.description: This bow is the result of Robbie's research. Ancient Sheikah technology allows it heightened functionality, Arrows fired from it travel in a perfectly straight line.

bows.name: Royal Guard's Bow
bows.description: This prototype Sheikah-made bow was designed to fight the Great Calamity. made with ancient technology, it boasts a high rate of fire and firepower but has low durability.

bows.name: Twilight Bow
bows.description: A bow used by the princess who fought the beasts of twilight alongside the hero. It's said to contain the spirits of light's power. It fires arrows straight and true, as if beams of light.

bows.name: Boko Bow
bows.description: A basic Bokoblin bow made of wood. It's made by taking any tree branch and tying a string to either end, so don't expect much in the way of combat effectiveness.

bows.name: Spiked Boko Bow
bows.description: An upgraded Boko Bow bound with animal bone to boost its durability and firepower. Its craftsmanship is sloppy, but it's light and easy to use.

bows.name: Dragon Bone Boko Bow
bows.description: A Boko bow reinforced by fossils. Bokoblins handpicked the materials it's made from, so it boasts a respectable firepower.

bows.name: Lizal Bow
bows.description: A wooden bow created by Lizalfos. It's reinforced by the bones of a large fish - a marked improvement over any standard wooden bow.

bows.name: Strengthened Lizal Bow
bows.description: A Lizal bow with a grip reinforced by metal. The body is made from the branches of a flexible tree that grows near water, which offers some serious destructive power.

bows.name: Steel Lizal Bow
bows.description: This bow is wielded by lizalfos who are expert marksmen. The metal that reinforces much of the weapon adds some additional weight but offers heightened durability.

bows.name: Lynel Bow
bows.description: A Lynel-made bow crafted from rough metal. True to the vicious nature of Lynel weaponry. It fires a spread of multiple arrows at once. Ideal for taking down quick-moving targets.

bows.name: Mighty Lynel Bow
bows.description: This massive Lynel bow sports a bowstring made from a metal so tough, mere Hylians have trouble drawing it back.

bows.name: Savage Lynel Bow
bows.description: This Lynel bow is made from a special steel found at the peak of Death Mountain. It has tremendous stopping power and can pierce thick armor as easily as thin paper.

bows.name: Duplex Bow
bows.description: A bow favored by the skilled archers of the Yiga Clan. It's been engineered to fire two arrows at once to ensure your target comes to a swift and none-too-pleasant halt.

material.name: Acorn
material.description: Often found on the ground near trees. Squirrels adore this nut, so you may have competition while foraging. Add one to a meal for a nutty seasoning.
material.uses:
Restores
Armor upgrades

material.name: Amber
material.description: A fossilized resin with a caramelesque sheen to it. It's been valued as a component in decorations and crafting since ancient times.
material.uses:
Sold for Rupees
Armor crafting
Armor upgrades

material.name: Ancient Core
material.description: This crystal was made using lost technology. At one time it was the power source for ancient machines. This item is very valuable to researchers.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Ancient Gear
material.description: A gear used in ancient machinery. Despite being incredibly old, its build quality is leaps and bounds above anything built using current technology.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Ancient Screw
material.description: A screw used in ancient machinery. It's made of an unknown material, and no matter how many times it's turned, its threads never seem to show signs of wear.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Ancient Shaft
material.description: A machine part used in ancient machinery. It's incredibly sturdy, and it's not made of any recognizable material. It may come in handy someday.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Ancient Spring
material.description: A spring used in ancient machinery. It is light and buoyant enough to float on water, and no matter how many times it's compressed, it never loses tension.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Apple
material.description: A common fruit found on trees all around Hyrule. Eat it fresh, or cook it to increase its effect.
material.uses: Restores

material.name: Armoranth
material.description: This tough medicinal plant cannot be broken, but it can be cooked. Its durable yet flexible fibers raise your defense when cooked into a dish.
material.uses: Boosts defense when cooked

material.name: Armored Carp
material.description: Calcium deposits in the scales of this ancient fish make them as hard as armor. Cooking it into a dish will fortify your bones, temporarily increasing your defense.
material.uses:
Restores
Boosts defense when cooked

material.name: Armored Porgy
material.description: This porgy's body is covered in armor-hard scales. The compounds in its scales, when cooked into a dish, fortify your bones and temporarily boost your defense.
material.uses:
Restores
Boosts defense when cooked

material.name: Big Hearty Radish
material.description: This hearty radish has grown much larger than the average radish. It's rich in analeptic compounds that, when cooked into a dish, temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
material.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

material.name: Big Hearty Truffle
material.description: Years of going unpicked have allowed this hearty truffle to grow quite large. It's chock-full of nutrients. When cooked into a dish, it temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
material.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

material.name: Bird Egg
material.description: A fresh bird egg necessary for making dishes such as omelets and crepes. You can snag them from birds' nests if you're sneaky. Nutritious and delicious, perfect.
material.uses: Restores

material.name: Bladed Rhino Beetle
material.description: This beetle's razor-sharp horns demand that you handle it with care. Boil the horns alongside monster parts to concoct an elixir that will raise your attack power.
material.uses: Can make elixirs that raise attack power

material.name: Blue Nightshade
material.description: A plant that grows in quieter areas of Hyrule. At night, it gives off a soft glow. Cook with it to increase your stealth.
material.uses:
Increases stealth when cooked
Armor upgrades

material.name: Bokoblin Fang
material.description: A tooth obtained from a Bokoblin. It's worn down and not very sharp, but it's still pretty hard. Cook it alongside a critter to make an elixir.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Bokoblin Guts
material.description: A rare material obtained by defeating a Bokoblin. It convulses on its own every now and then, which is really creepy, but perhaps it has a use.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Bokoblin Horn
material.description: The severed horn of a Bokoblin, a creature often encountered on the plains of Hyrule. It isn't edible, but it can be tossed into a stew with some critters to make an elixir.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Bright-Eyed Crab
material.description: This crab appears in large numbers when it rains. On bite of its delectable meat, and you'll forget all your exhaustion. Replenishes your stamina when cooked into a dish.
material.uses:
Restores
Restores stamina when cooked

material.name: Cane Sugar
material.description: When boiled with other ingredients, the cane breaks down into a sweet juice necessary for making cakes and other sweets. It's commonly found in ingredients stores.
material.uses: General cooking and specific cooking recipes

material.name: Chickaloo Tree Nut
material.description: Small birds love this nut. You can eat it raw for a minor effect, but it can also be added as a spice to other recipes.
material.uses: Restores

material.name: Chillfin Trout
material.description: This blue trout prefers cold bodies of water. Its skin contains enzymes that keep its body cool, and when cooked into a dish, it will temporarily boost your heat resistance.
material.uses:
Restores
Boosts heat resistance when cooked

material.name: Chillshroom
material.description: Often found at the base of pine trees in cold climates, these mushrooms are cool to the touch and can be used to cook dishes that allow you to stay cool even in arid regions.
material.uses:
Restores
Boosts heat resistance when cooked

material.name: Chuchu Jelly
material.description: A gelatinous substance that came from a Chuchu. It's unusable in this state, but applying a bit of elemental stimulation will change its form.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Cold Darner
material.description: This dragonfly prefers the cool shade of trees to the warmth of the sun. Its wings disperse heat from its body, which can be cooked into a heat-resistant elixir.
material.uses: Can make elixirs that raise heat resistance

material.name: Cool Safflina
material.description: This medicinal plant grows in high elevations, such as mountains in the Hebra or Gerudo regions. When cooked into a dish, it will temporarily increase your heat resistance.
material.uses: Boosts heat resistance when cooked

material.name: Courser Bee Honey
material.description: Honey straight from the hive is chock-full of nutrients. Cooking this into a meal unlocks the potential of these nutrients and provides a stamina-recovery effect.
material.uses:
Restores
Restores stamina when cooked
Armor upgrades

material.name: Diamond
material.description: The most precious gem one can find in Hyrule, its signature sparkle has charmed Hyruleans for generations. As such, it has sold for a very high price since ancient times.
material.uses:
Sold for Rupees
Armor crafting
Champion weapon crafting

material.name: Dinraal's Claw
material.description: This valuable claw was plucked from the red spirit Dinraal. It was extremely hot before it was removed. You could sell it to a store, but it must have some other use.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Dinraal's Scale
material.description: This precious scale fell from the red spirit Dinraal. It emanates a great heat, You can use it in cooking, but eating it seems like a waste.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Electric Darner
material.description: This rare dragonfly only appears in the rain. Its wings direct electricity away from its body. Cook it with monster parts for an electricity-resistant elixir.
material.uses: Can make elixirs that raise shock resistance

material.name: Electric Keese Wing
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Electric Safflina
material.description: This medicinal plant grows abundantly in the Gerudo Desert. Its peculiar fibers conduct electricity, which will increase your electricity resistance when cooked into a dish.
material.uses: Increases shock resistance when cooked

material.name: Energetic Rhino Beetle
material.description: This valuable beetle can live up to ten years. When cooked with monster parts, its impressive vitality translates into an elixir that will greatly restore your stamina.
material.uses:
Can make elixirs that restore stamina
Armor upgrades

material.name: Endura Carrot
material.description: Highly valued as a medicinal plant, this carrot contains large amounts of nourishing energy. When cooked into a dish, it boosts your stamina beyond its maximum limit.
material.uses:
Restores
Used in cooking to increase max stamina
Fed to horses to increase max horse stamina

material.name: Endura Shroom
material.description: A rare yellowish-orange mushroom. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your stamina limit.
material.uses:
Restores
Increases max stamina when cooked

material.name: Fairy
material.description: This fairy will fly from your pouch and heal all your wounds the moment you lose your last heart. It's easily mistaken for a firefly at first, but it glows in the daylight as well as night.
material.uses:
Restores
Automatically used upon death

material.name: Farosh's Claw
material.description: This claw was plucked from the golden spirit Farosh. Its electricity was expelled before it was removed, so it's safe to handle. A store will buy it, but it must have some other use.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Farosh's Scale
material.description: This precious scale fell from the golden spirit Farosh. It contains powerful electricity within. You can cook it, but eating it seems like a waste.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Fire Keese Wing
material.description: A rare Fire Keese wing. There isn't enough Fire Keese attached to it to burn you, but it does have a slight warmth to it. It can be used as an ingredient for elixirs.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Fireproof Lizard
material.description: This rare lizard can only be found in the Eldin region. Its scales have heat-resistant properties, so when cooked with monster parts, it produces a heat-resistant elixir.
material.uses:
Can make elixirs that raise heat resistance
Armor upgrades

material.name: Fleet-Lotus Seeds
material.description: The plant that bears these seeds grows near deep water. The roots draw nutrients from the water, which boosts your movement speed when the seeds are cooked into a dish.
material.uses:
Restores
Increases speed when cooked

material.name: Flint
material.description: Strike it with a metallic weapon to generate a spark. The portable fire starter breaks after one use, but it can create a long-lasting flame if you use it near firewood.
material.uses:
Fire starting
Champion weapon crafting

material.name: Fortified Pumpkin
material.description: An extremely tough pumpkin raised in village fields. When cooked, that toughness manifests itself by considerably upping defense.
material.uses:
Restores
Boosts defense when cooked

material.name: Fresh Milk
material.description: This fresh milk comes from Hateno cows and white goats kept in the village. It's delicious on its own but can also be used as an ingredient in soups and stews.
material.uses: Restores

material.name: Giant Ancient Core
material.description: A giant energy crystal made using lost ancient technology. Cores this large are an extremely rare find. A researcher would probably know how to use this.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Goat Butter
material.description: Butter made from the milk of a domesticated white goat. In addition to being used in dishes like stews and meunière. It's often used when making cakes and other sweets.
material.uses: General cooking and specific cooking recipes

material.name: Goron Spice
material.description: Made from several types of spices, this secret Goron seasoning has been handed down for generations. An initial wave of spiciness paves the way for the sweetness.
material.uses: General cooking and specific cooking recipes

material.name: Hearty Bass
material.description: This large fish lives near the shoreline. Its sizable body can restore a lot of nutrient. When cooked into a dish, it will temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
material.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked
Armor upgrades

material.name: Hearty Blueshell Snail
material.description: This snail lives on sandy beaches in large numbers. Its flesh contains a high amount of stimulants, so when cooked into a dish, it temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
material.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

material.name: Hearty Durian
material.description: This fruit's odor earned it the nickname "king of fruits". It offers immense restorative power; dishes cooked with it will temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
material.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

material.name: Hearty Lizard
material.description: This rare lizard lives deep in the forests. It feeds on high-nutrient foods, giving it great vitality. When used to make elixirs, they temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
material.uses: Can make elixirs which increase max hearts

material.name: Hearty Radish
material.description: A rare radish that grows best in sunny plains. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
material.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

material.name: Hearty Salmon
material.description: This fish makes its home in cold water, giving it extra layers of fat. It temporarily increases your maximum hearts when used in cooking.
material.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

material.name: Hearty Truffle
material.description: This rare mushroom has a rich scent. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
material.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

material.name: Hightail Lizard
material.description: A lizard found throughout Hyrule. It's a bit slow to react at times, but if given a chance to escape, it will dart off quickly. Cook it with monster parts for a speed-boosting elixir.
material.uses:
Can make elixirs which increase speed
Armor upgrades

material.name: Hinox Guts
material.description: A giant, smelly Hinox organ of unknown function. Upon closer inspection, it appears to be quivering, It can be used to make an elixir, but some say it has other uses, as well.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Hinox Toenail
material.description: A nail obtained from a Hinox. It's as thick as a plate of armor and can be stewed with critters to make elixirs.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon

material.name: Hinox Tooth
material.description: A tooth obtained from a Hinox. It's so large, it's hard to believe it's a real tooth. It can be used to make elixirs.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon

material.name: Hot-Footed Frog
material.description: A quick frog that can be found hopping around near water. Cook it with monster parts to draw out its speed-boost effect.
material.uses:
Can make elixirs which increase speed

material.name: Hydromelon
material.description: This resilient fruit can flourish even in the heat of the desert. The hydrating liquid inside provides a cooling effect that, when cooked, increases your heat resistance.
material.uses:
Restores
Boosts heat resistance when cooked

material.name: Hylian Rice
material.description: This grain is a favorite among residents of Kakariko Village. It's grown in regions with a lot of water and is quite versatile. Used as an ingredient in things like risotto and rice balls.
material.uses: Restores

material.name: Hylian Shroom
material.description: A common mushroom found near trees around Hyrule. Eat it to restore half a heart.
material.uses: Restores

material.name: Hyrule Bass
material.description: An ordinary fish that can be found all over Hyrule. Can be eaten raw, but cooking it amplifies its healing benefits.
material.uses:
Restores
Armor upgrades

material.name: Hyrule Herb
material.description: This healthy herb grows abundantly in the plains of Hyrule. Cook it before eating to increase the number of hearts it restores.
material.uses: Restores

material.name: Ice Keese Wing
material.description: A rare Ice Keese wing. Its frozen surface gleams attractively, but its usefulness isn't readily apparent.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Icy Lizalfos Tail
material.description: The severed tail of an Ice-Breath Lizalfos. Its hard scales and flesh make it unsuitable for cooking, but it's perfect for making elixirs.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Ironshell Crab
material.description: This crab's shell is particularly hard. When cooked into a dish, its fat and meat bolster the body to increase your defense.
material.uses:
Restores
Boosts defense when cooked

material.name: Ironshroom
material.description: The cap of this mushroom is very hard. Use it when cooking to prepare a dish that increases your defense.
material.uses:
Restores
Boosts defense when cooked

material.name: Keese Eyeball
material.description: A rare material dropped by a defeated Keese. It's fun to look at, but it doesn't seem to have much use at first glance. But it must be good for something...
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Keese Wing
material.description: The wing of a Keese. It's covered with very short, sharp fur. It's not much use by itself, but you can mix it with critters to make something useful.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Lizalfos Horn
material.description: This winding horn once grew atop the head of a Lizalfos. It's too hard to use for cooking, but stores are willing to buy it from you. It can also be used to make elixirs.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Lizalfos Talon
material.description: This talon once grew from the elbow of a Lizalfos. You can stew it with critters to make elixirs, but it may have some other uses, as well.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Lizalfos Tail
material.description: The severed tail of a Lizalfos. It continues to wriggle even after being separated from its body. That kind of vitality makes it highly valued as an ingredient in elixirs.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Luminous Stone
material.description: This mysterious mineral gives off a pale blue glow in the dark, which some believe to be souls of the undead. Apparently, this stone can be used as a base to make special clothing.
material.uses:
Sold for Rupees

material.name: Lynel Guts
material.description: This highly sought-after ingredient can only be obtained from a Lynel. It pulses with the vitality of a Lynel, a strength that makes it invaluable as an ingredient for elixirs.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Lynel Hoof
material.description: This rare ingredient can be obtained only from a Lynel's foot. It's larger and heavier than a horse's hoof. It's useful for making elixirs but may have uses beyond that.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

material.name: Lynel Horn
material.description: The Lynel this horn once grew upon surely misses it. It's exceptionally hard—so hard that most blades cannot scratch it. Throw it into a stew with critters to make elixirs.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon

material.name: Mighty Bananas
material.description: This fruit grows mainly in tropical forests of the Faron region. When it's used as an ingredient, the resulting dish will temporarily increase your attack power.
material.uses:
Restores
Raises attack power when cooked

material.name: Mighty Carp
material.description: This freshwater fish lives alongside its less mighty carp ilk. A compound in its liver promotes muscle growth. Dishes cooked with it will temporarily increase your attack power.
material.uses:
Restores
Raises attack power when cooked

material.name: Mighty Porgy
material.description: This ocean-dwelling fish comes with one rude attitude. The compounds in its flesh elevate your competitive spirit when it's cooked into a dish, thus increasing your attack power.
material.uses:
Restores
Raises attack power when cooked

material.name: Mighty Thistle
material.description: This medicinal plant is known for its sharp thorns and for the fruit it bears. The fruit contains a compound that increases attack power when cooked into a dish.
material.uses: Raises attack power when cooked

material.name: Moblin Fang
material.description: A sharp fang obtained from a Moblin. It's too hard to be reshaped into a tool, but it can be tossed into a stew with some critters to create elixirs.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon

material.name: Moblin Guts
material.description: This prized ingredient can be obtained from Moblins. Its odor is too pungent for normal food preparation, but stew it with some critters to make elixirs.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon

material.name: Moblin Horn
material.description: This splendid horn once grew atop the head of a Moblin. It can't be used in normal food recipes, but it does have some use as an ingredient in making elixirs.
material.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon

material.name: Molduga Fin

Elixir creation

material.name: Molduga Guts

material.name: Naydra's Claw

Elixir creation

material.name: Octorok Eyeball

Elixir creation

material.name: Palm Fruit
material.description: Fruit from palm trees that grow near the ocean. It doesn't offer any special effects but will increase your heart recovery when used as an ingredient.

material.name: Raw Bird Thigh
material.description: A high-quality piece of meat that's hard to come by. You can eat it raw, but cooking it first will recover more hearts.

material.name: Raw Bird Drumstick
material.description: This meat is tougher and chewier than a standard steak. Tastes better cooked.

material.name: Raw Gourmet Meat
material.description: This prized cut of meat is usually from a large animal. Any connoisseur would rank this tender, juicy cut of meat "gourmet." Expect an exquisite meal when cooking with this.
material.uses: Restores

material.name: Raw Meat
material.description: Meat obtained from animals in plains and forests. You can eat it raw, but cooking it will make it more delicious and nutritious.
material.uses: Restores

material.name: Raw Prime Meat
material.description: A fresh, high-quality piece of animal meat. This stuff isn't easy to come by, so savor it. Cook it to recover more hearts.
material.uses: Restores

material.name: Raw Whole Bird
material.description: This prized meat can be obtained from certain birds. It gets full points for flavor, nutrition, and volume. It pairs perfectly with other ingredients or can be enjoyed alone.
material.uses: Restores

Armor upgrades

material.name: Sizzlefin Trout
material.description: This red trout prefers warm bodies of water. It has a special organ specifically for storing heat. When cooked into a dish, it temporarily boosts your resistance to the cold.
material.uses:
Restores
Boosts cold resistance when cooked

material.name: Smotherwing Butterfly
material.description: This rare butterfly lives in volcanic regions. Its body contains a heat-resistant liquid, which can be turned into a topical elixir that offers resistance to flames.
material.uses:
Can make elixirs which boost heat resistance
Armor upgrades

material.name: Sneaky River Snail
material.description: This large, glow-in-the-dark snail lives in fresh water. When cooked into a dish, it heightens your senses so you can move about silently.
material.uses:
Restores
Increases stealth when cooked
Armor upgrades

material.name: Spicy Pepper
material.description: This pepper is exploding with spice. Cook with it to create dishes that will raise your body temperature and help you withstand the cold.
material.uses:
Restores
Boosts heat resistance when cooked

material.name: Stamella Shroom
material.description: A green mushroom that grows near trees in the forest. It's chock-full of natural energy. Cook it to release its stamina-restoration properties.
material.uses:
Restores
Restores stamina when cooked

material.name: Staminoka Bass
material.description: This Hyrule bass got to be the biggest fish by never getting caught (until now). Its long life results in a cooked dish that will restore a lot of stamina.
material.uses:
Restores
Restores stamina when cooked

material.name: Star Fragment
material.description: A mysterious stone fragment that fell from the sky. It looks like it would fetch a good price, but you may be able to use it in certain recipes as well.
material.uses: Armor upgrading

material.name: Stealthfin Trout
material.description: Consuming the bioluminescent compound that makes this fish glow in the dark will increase concentration. Dishes cooked with it will suppress noise when consumed.
material.uses:
Restores
Increases stealth when cooked

material.name: Summerwing Butterfly
material.description: A butterfly found in the woods and plains of warm regions. Its wings absorb the warmth of the sun. Cook it with monster parts to create an elixir that makes you feel warm and fuzzy.
material.uses: Can make elixirs which boost cold resistance

material.name: Sunset Firefly
material.description: These fireflies glow gently in the dark. When cooked with monster parts, the compound that causes it to glow results in an elixir that will allow you to move more quietly.
material.uses:
Can make elixirs which increase stealth
Armor upgrades

material.name: Sunshroom
material.description: A bright red mushroom that grows in hot climates. Imbued with the power of heat, they can be used to cook dishes that will allow you to endure the bitter cold.
material.uses:
Restores
Boosts cold resistance when cooked

material.name: Swift Carrot
material.description: This carrot is cultivated extensively in Kakariko Village. It strengthens the legs and hips when cooked into a dish, which helps increase your movement speed.
material.uses:
Restores
Increases speed when cooked

material.name: Swift Violet
material.description: This vitality-rich flower blooms mainly on cliffsides. When cooked into a dish, the nourishing compounds increase your movement speed.
material.uses:
Increases speed when cooked
Armor upgrades

material.name: Tabantha Wheat
material.description: This grain is cultivated extensively on the Tabantha Plains. It's ground finely with a millstone to be used in cooking. Use it to make things such as stews and breads.
material.uses: Restores

material.name: Thunderwing Butterfly
material.description: This rare butterfly only shows itself when it rains. The organs in its body produce an insulating compound. When made into an elixir, it offers electrical resistance.
material.uses: Can make elixirs which boost shock resistance

material.name: Tireless Frog
material.description: This rare frog only ventures out in the rain. When cooked with monster parts, the elixir it produces will temporarily increase your maximum stamina.
material.uses: Can make elixirs which increase max stamina

material.name: Topaz
material.description: This precious yellow gem contains the power of electricity. It's been known to fetch a high price since ancient times.
material.uses:

material.name: Warm Darner
material.description: This dragonfly has a special organ that causes it to sweat profusely. Cook it with monster parts for an elixir that will raise your core temperatures so you can resist the cold.
material.uses: Can make elixirs which boost cold resistance

material.name: Warm Safflina
material.description: This medicinal plant grows in hot regions, such as the Gerudo Desert. It's warm to the touch and increases your cold resistance when cooked into a dish.

Boosts cold resistance when cooked

material.name: White Chuchu Jelly

Can be created by killing any ChuChu with an Ice weapon

material.name: Wildberry
material.description: A fruit that grows in cold, snowy regions known for its tangy, sweet flavor. It doesn't offer any special effects, but it's a popular cooking ingredient.
material.uses: Restores

material.name: Winterwing Butterfly
material.description: The powdery scales of this butterfly's wings cool the air around it. Watching it flutter around snowflakes is a thing of beauty. Cook it with monster parts for a heat-resistant elixir.
material.uses: Boosts heat resistance when cooked

material.name: Wood
material.description: A portable bundle of wood. You can use this to make a campfire if you have something to light it.
